content:
• Monday, May 6, 2013
  • PSEC

    More on Prospect Capital (PSEC) FQ3 earnings: NAV of $10.71/share off $0.10 from Dec. 31 and...

    More on Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) FQ3 earnings: NAV of $10.71/share off $0.10 from Dec. 31 and against today's closing price of $11.11. Net investment income/share guidance for FQ4 of $0.26-$0.32. Accumulated NII over earnings thus far this fiscal year is $0.22/share. Portfolio yield of 13.9% on March 31. Market value of assets on non-accrual is 1.3% of total assets, down from 1.9% at start of fiscal year. Conference call tomorrow at 11 ET. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 PM
  • ININ

    More on Interactive Intelligence Group (NASDAQ:ININ): Q1 beats across the board with a 39% surge...

    More on Interactive Intelligence Group (NASDAQ:ININ): Q1 beats across the board with a 39% surge in earnings as the technology company was helped by a tax credit and a revenue boost. The company saw solid order growth across all regions, particularly in cloud-based orders and revenue. Total orders +31% Y/Y, cloud-based orders +42%. Cloud-based revenue +42% to $7.1M. Shares +6.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 PM
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG): FQ2 misses on all counts as net sales declined by 11% Y/Y. Profit...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (NYSE:SMG): FQ2 misses on all counts as net sales declined by 11% Y/Y. Profit fell even further, down 21% over the same period as lower-than-usual temperatures in March hurt sales of lawn-and-garden products, causing a significant delay in the start of the lawn and garden season in nearly all North American and European markets. Gross margin narrowed to 37.1% from 39.4%. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM
  • HOLX

    More on Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): Company posts a mixed FQ2 report, beating on its EPS but missing...

    More on Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): Company posts a mixed FQ2 report, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue. Net losses widened amid acquisition-related charges and other items which masked strong revenue growth. For the year, the company lowered its EPS estimate to between $1.54 to $1.56 on revenue of around $2.53B to $2.55B. For the current quarter, it now sees earnings of $0.36 to $0.37 on revenue of between $625M to $630M, below Street estimates for $0.41 on $655M, respectively. Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 PM
  • MELI

    More on MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q1 comies in mixed, beating on its EPS but missing on...

    More on MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI): Q1 comies in mixed, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue. Total sales jumped 23% Y/Y, but net profit fell 11% as the online marketplace saw its bottom-line hurt by currency devaluation. FX losses for the first quarter of 2013 were $6.2M, versus losses of $1M a year earlier. Gross margin also narrowed to 72.1% from 74.8%, while operating expenses increased 21% to $45.5M. Shares +10.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM
  • NLS

    Nautilus (NYSE:NLS): Q1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $59.2M beats by $4.25M. Shares...

  • EOG

    More on EOG Resources' (NYSE:EOG) Q1 results: Total production +6% to 475K boe/day; crude...

    More on EOG Resources' (NYSE:EOG) Q1 results: Total production +6% to 475K boe/day; crude oil production +33%. Targeting peer-group leading high growth rates of crude production for 2013-17; says its "outstanding asset base allows us to define long-term production gains with confidence because these onshore domestic assets are largely underpinned by high rate-of-return crude oil growth." Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: SNTS +10%. MELI +9%. NLS +9%. ININ +6%. ROIC +6%....

  • EA

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) +2.1% AH after announcing a multi-year deal with Disney (NYSE:DIS)...

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) +2.1% AH after announcing a multi-year deal with Disney (NYSE:DIS) to make new Star Wars games "spanning all interactive platforms and the most popular game genres." Disney maintains the rights to develop mobile, online, and social games for the franchise. The deal comes shortly after Disney decided to shutter LucasArts' game development studio, and close to 18 months after EA launched Star Wars: The Old Republic, whose performance has underwhelmed. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • MKTG

    Marketo (NASDAQ:MKTO) sets a price range of $11-$13 for its 6.06M-share IPO. That gives the...

    Marketo (NASDAQ:MKTO) sets a price range of $11-$13 for its 6.06M-share IPO. That gives the cloud marketing automation software firm, which many still think will eventually get bought out, a valuation range of $393M-$464M. Marketo posted Q1 revenue of $19.7M (+61% Y/Y), and a net loss of $9.5M; its deferred revenue balance stood at $24.5M. Meanwhile, rival Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG) is up 5.9% AH after beating Q1 estimates and guiding for Q2 revenue of $45.5M-$46.5M and EPS of $0.02 (consensus is at $46.1M and $0.03. Marketo also competes with ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) and Oracle-acquired Eloqua. (S-1) (2012 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM

    More on Dynavax (NASDAQ:DVAX): Q1 misses on bottom line estimates as the company logs higher...

    More on Dynavax (NASDAQ:DVAX): Q1 misses on bottom line estimates as the company logs higher R&D and SG&A expenses and revenue declines slightly Y/Y. Total expenses rose by 21% over the prior year period, due primarily to the purchase of a Heplisav component as well as severance expenses, including non-cash stock-based compensation charges. Shares -1.7% AH.

  • SNTS

    More on Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS): Q1 blows out bottom line estimates, doubling what the Street was...

    More on Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS): Q1 blows out bottom line estimates, doubling what the Street was looking for on higher royalty and licensing payments, plus significant growth in net sales of a number of its key drugs. Total revenues grew 73% Y/Y, boosted by the commercial launch of its colitis drug Ulceris and a big jump in prescriptions written: Glumetza new prescriptions +21%, total prescriptions +18%; Clyoset new prescriptions +21%, total prescriptions +44%. Additionally, sales of Zegerid since its re-launch in February after regaining exclusivity nearly tripled to $24.5M. Shares +10.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 1 Comment

    Shares of Santarus (NASDAQ:SNTS) resume trading, currently +8.5%.

  • RKUS

    Ruckus (NYSE:RKUS) blames its Q1 miss on "delayed deployments by several service provider...

    Ruckus (NYSE:RKUS) blames its Q1 miss on "delayed deployments by several service provider customers in the Americas, as well as challenging market conditions in China;" company insists competition isn't a factor. Q2 guidance is for revenue of $61M-$64M and EPS of $0.03-$0.04, largely below a consensus of $67.1M and $0.04. Gross margin rose 170 bps Q/Q and 390 bps Y/Y to 67.9%, a big reason the EPS miss wasn't as bad as the revenue miss. Opex +62% Y/Y, well above rev. growth of 27%. RKUS -17.9% AH. ARUN -2.8% in sympathy. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM

  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold (EGO -1.8%) is downgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital, citing concerns about...

    Eldorado Gold (EGO -1.8%) is downgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital, citing concerns about ongoing permitting delays at Eastern Dragon and lack of clarity regarding approval for Perama Hill. The firm also is cautious on potential headline and geopolitical risk given what appears to be a highly politicized situation in Greece regarding EGO's build-out plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • DCO

    Ducommun (DCO +6%) racks up a new 52-week high today ahead of its earnings release after the...

    Ducommun (DCO +6%) racks up a new 52-week high today ahead of its earnings release after the market close. The company, which makes and engineers aerostructure, and electromechanical components, is expected to report earnings of $0.41 a share, up from $0.26 a year ago, on revenue of $186M, up sequentially from $184M. Just last month the company announced it had inked a new long-term supply agreement from Boeing to continue to produce spoilers for the its Next-Generation 737 airplane.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • THO

    Thor Industries (THO +3%) rises markedly for the second straight session after announcing the...

    Thor Industries (THO +3%) rises markedly for the second straight session after announcing the sale of a subsidiary which manufactures ambulances, a move which provides THO with the opportunity to refocus on its core business. The stock is up ~8.5% since last Thursday when the company announced record preliminary sales of $1.05B and a 28% increase in consolidated backlog for FQ3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC -1.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at ISI Group, which says even as the...

    Exelon (EXC -1.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at ISI Group, which says even as the stock appears fairly priced to current forward power curves, it has significant exposure to rising power prices and/or a recovery in competitive energy margins; a $0.50/mmbtu change in gas price could impact valuation by 9%, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • ALGN

    Align Technology (ALGN +3.8%) jumps on reports it's won a ruling against ClearCorrect over...

    Align Technology (ALGN +3.8%) jumps on reports it's won a ruling against ClearCorrect over dental patents, bolstering its ongoing effort to block importation of ClearCorrect braces. The patents cover a wide range of [[ALGN]'s processes and include patents previously challenged and validated by the USPTO through re-examination. The company is seeking both monetary damages and injunctive relief against further infringement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware (RH +2%) gains again as share approach all-time highs on a post-earning...

    Restoration Hardware (RH +2%) gains again as share approach all-time highs on a post-earning breakout with bulls still running the show. The retailer is a bit of an outlier as it relies on sizzling same-store sales (+26%) and direct sales (+41%) for growth instead of new store openings. The company's catalog is also still relevant and helps drive traffic the old-fashioned way.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • SYPR

    Microcap industrial manufacturer Sypris (SYPR +12%) pops on the back of an article in Seeking...

    Microcap industrial manufacturer Sypris (SYPR +12%) pops on the back of an article in Seeking Alpha yesterday saying that the company may be significantly undervalued. The report says that investors have been far too aggressive pricing in negative growth, and are failing to factor in a likely rebound in sales to the commercial vehicle market. Additionally, the company has already seen a 16% increase in year-over-year EPS and better gross margins, so with tangible book value at $2.76/share, a debt/equity ratio of 0.30, and cash per share of nearly $1, the stock could see an upside move as much as 100%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • SGNT

    Sagent Pharmaceuticals (SGNT -0.2%) gives back an early 9% lead to trade back into the red today...

    Sagent Pharmaceuticals (SGNT -0.2%) gives back an early 9% lead to trade back into the red today following an earlier Q1 earnings beat and the announcement that it's acuired the remaining 50% interest in its China joint venture Kanghong Sagent Pharmaceutical for $25M. The company also says it expects FY13 net revenue to be around $220M to $250M, and net income to be between $5M and $15M. Street estimates are for the company to report revenue of $238M and net income of $2.4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • RENN

    Chinese Internet stocks are surging after equities rallied in Shanghai and Hong Kong in spite of...

    Chinese Internet stocks are surging after equities rallied in Shanghai and Hong Kong in spite of a major drop in China's services PMI. In addition to Qihoo (previous), winners include Renren (RENN +12.2%), YY (YY +13.3%), Baidu (BIDU +3.8%), Sina (SINA +2.8%), Sohu (SOHU +3.4%), Changyou (CYOU +4.3%), and Perfect World (PWRD +5%). YY is now up 20% since posting a strong Q1 report on Thursday afternoon; revenue rose 130.5% Y/Y to RMB315M ($50.7M), and EPS of $0.23 beat consensus by $0.06. Revenue is expected to hit RMB330M-340M in Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • ROAN

    Wells Fargo's defense of Linn Energy (LINE -6.5%) and LinnCo (LNCO -6.6%) following Barron's...

    Wells Fargo's defense of Linn Energy (LINE -6.5%) and LinnCo (LNCO -6.6%) following Barron's negative article has lifted shares a bit from earlier lows. Wells considers today's selloff a buying opportunity, as the article merely "brings up old points of contention"; the firm continues to believe LINE’s distribution is secure and poised to grow at a mid-single-digit annual pace over the next five years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 23 Comments
  • GTE

    Gran Tierra Energy (GTE +9.2%) moves sharply higher after reporting Q1 results that beat...

    Gran Tierra Energy (GTE +9.2%) moves sharply higher after reporting Q1 results that beat estimates on the top and bottom lines. Q1 EPS was $0.20 vs. $0.15 analyst consensus; revenue totaled $205M vs. consensus of $188M. GTE attributes its strong start to the year with new oil exploration well success in Peru, and record production of 23.4K boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • SMRT

    Stein Mart (SMRT +6.9%) gets some loving today after posting a solid FQ4 earnings beat after the...

    Stein Mart (SMRT +6.9%) gets some loving today after posting a solid FQ4 earnings beat after the close on Friday, and announcing it's regained compliance with Nasdaq rules after filing financial results for its Q2 through Q4 of FY12, and restated results for previous periods. The clothing and home furniture retailer had taken a big hit from accounting errors recently, but has risen nearly 20% since last Thursday as investors positioned themselves in anticipation of the upbeat report.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • MRK

    Merck (MRK -1.3%) gets no love today from the FDA's approval of Liptruxet late Friday, as the...

    Merck (MRK -1.3%) gets no love today from the FDA's approval of Liptruxet late Friday, as the stock is likely dragged down with the rest of the big pharma names on the back of a CNBC report that criticizes their earnings so far. The article points to the fact that pharmaceutical companies have seen a 4.7% contraction in earnings, and a 3.2% drop in revenue this quarter. Why? Morningstar's Damien Cover says there are two primary reasons: FX impact, especially from the yen, and intensified generic competition from patent losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • PALDF

    North American Palladium (PAL -18%) plummets after saying "preliminary findings [at the Lac des...

    North American Palladium (PAL -18%) plummets after saying "preliminary findings [at the Lac des Iles mine] identified some negative trends [and] management believes that the low end of … production guidance will be difficult to achieve." Furthermore, operating cash flows probably won't support planned capex and as a result, the company will likely have to tap the debt and/or equity markets this year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    More on the BofA/MBIA settlement: Bank of America (BAC +4%) will pay MBIA's mortgage insurance...

    More on the BofA/MBIA settlement: Bank of America (BAC +4%) will pay MBIA's mortgage insurance arm about $1.6B plus some IOUs, bringing the total amount to $1.7B, reports the WSJ. Additionally, the bank will take about a 5% stake in the holding company, MBIA (MBI +41.9%). It's a win-win as MBIA Insurance gets a lifeline and BofA removes the potential of a far larger award at trial. Congrats to BTIG's Mark Palmer and keen bloggers like Christian Herzeca who recognized MBIA's legal "loss" last week as a big push for BofA to get this thing settled.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM

    Groupon's (GRPN -5%) Q2 guidance will likely miss consensus when the company delivers its Q1...

    Groupon's (GRPN -5%) Q2 guidance will likely miss consensus when the company delivers its Q1 report on Wednesday, says Piper's Gene Munster in a note that's pressuring the daily deals leader. Munster was bullish on Groupon prior to its Q4 disaster; shares have since recovered most of their post-earnings losses.

Looking at its pipeline, the company says it anticipates completing patient accrual for its Impress trial of algenpantucel-L for surgically resected pancreatic cancer, and it recently presented preclinical results for its second IDO pathway inhibitor drug candidate, NLG919, at the American Association for Cancer Research annual meeting.     Federal Signal (FSS -2.1%) moves up despite posting a mixed Q1 report this morning, coming up shy on the top line but beating on a per share basis. Net sales were up 2% Y/Y, but orders were down 14% versus last year, primarily due to weaker international demand and Q112 results being skewed by a large order from an international customer. Operating income rose 17%, the result of improved gross margins within its Environmental Solutions Group, and an absence of restructuring costs. For H113, reaffirms EPS guidance of $0.20 - $0.25.

    Another strong day of trading for Tesla Motors (TSLA +4.2%) ahead of its earnings release scheduled for Wednesday takes shares back over $56. Barclays is still on board (sort of), saying the "hyper growth" company could go as high as $131 per share if the EV automaker crosses over into the mass affluent market - but warning it might be an all-or-nothing proposition. Barclays' TSLA roulette: A successful third-generation product could take EPS up to $14.58 in six years, which after applying a 12X multiple and discounting 5% annually brings $131 in play. A misfiring production schedule brings in cash flow nightmares and a scenario where shares crash to $5.
